name: sfchronicle
text:
The Manor of Being, an 11-person intentional community in S.F., gathered for a weekly coronavirus meeting. First item: a risk calculator designed to make day-to-day decisions easier.

But reaching consensus on it wasn't going to be easy. https://t.co/SmDWu2LnBj

name: sfchronicle
text:
Happy 30 years, Kruk & Kuip!

What's your favorite memory of the pair of @SFGiants broadcasters? https://t.co/PVoXIwGSRe

name: sfchronicle
text:
Politicians in the Bay Area and California reacted on Thursday to the death of Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg, who died of complications from metastatic pancreatic cancer.
https://t.co/ts4dC2beJV

name: sfchronicle
text:
Politicians in the Bay Area and California reacted on Friday to the death of Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg, who died of complications from metastatic pancreatic cancer.

name: sfchronicle
text: A previous tweet stated that politicians reacted to Ginsburg's death on Thursday. This tweet has been deleted https://t.co/BM7kJaFoYD

name: sfchronicle
text:
The police shooting of 23-year-old Miles Hall man prompted reform in Walnut Creek, as well as a $4 million settlement for his family.
https://t.co/eSfyuxeOTy

name: sfchronicle
text: “We have lost a giant among us," tweeted Gavin Newsom. He followed his statement on Twitter with a simple request to followers: “VOTE.” https://t.co/VyjfR7op0E

name: sfchronicle
text: “Bring a candle, and wear a mask,” said San Francisco Supervisor Rafael Mandelman ahead of a vigil planned for 7 p.m. Friday at Harvey Milk Plaza in San Francisco. https://t.co/q7CmlWKk1H

name: sfchronicle
text:
Shelter-in-place is tricky enough, but for an 11-person intentional community in the Mission District, it required a whole new level of intentionality. @annievain talks about how the Manor of Being made it work.

Apple > https://t.co/BnQdzSVJAW
Spotify > https://t.co/rJbfTWt0eY

name: sfchronicle
text:
As private schools gear up for in-person classes, all eyes are on S.F.’s public school district. 

The district and teachers union have just scheduled the first negotiations sessions for next week. https://t.co/iqF1PjQpJk

name: sfchronicle
text:
The Creek Fire wasn't one of the state’s largest. But it outpaced evacuation alerts and caught thousands on trails, campsites and lakes unaware. Escape wasn’t possible... not without help.

Inside one helicopter crew's high-stakes rescue mission: https://t.co/qlKFZiwhYJ

name: sfchronicle
text:
How does an S.F. house with 11 roommates navigate the coronavirus?

 - daily stand-up meetings
 - nominate members to a task force
 - majority vote on outside interactions
 - use a risk budget calculator

https://t.co/fGfqFU421O

name: sfchronicle
text: RT @JohnSheaHey: Albert Pujols hit his 661st home run to pass Willie Mays. Here's what Mays said about Pujols and 660: https://t.co/HR6GWjrX9I

name: sfchronicle
text:
"Get him to Station 62.”

A tiny firehouse turned field hospital became one fire victim's last hope. But Station 62 was itself in the path of the flames: https://t.co/nLHMuipuUb

name: sfchronicle
text:
College football presses on with a season of alarming uncertainty, at a time when the pandemic is surging and campus outbreaks are common.

By @Bruce_Jenkins1: https://t.co/Aj1ZpQA46k

name: sfchronicle
text:
Ruth Bader Ginsburg broke barriers and delivered justice, said San Francisco Mayor London Breed. 

“Her passing is a devastating loss for our country. We can honor her life by continuing to fight for a more just society.”

https://t.co/4Lc7f6aHui

name: sfchronicle
text: An increase in daily tides of as little as 2 feet, which some forecasts anticipate as soon as 2050, could send water spilling onto downtown S.F. blocks and make the subway tunnel beneath Market Street susceptible to flooding in a major storm. https://t.co/x3qZLkEUGh https://t.co/uahQtK5ble

name: sfchronicle
text: In this week's Dish column, writer Omar Mamoon talks to Felipe Reyes, who sells handmade tacos de canasta, a steamed version of tacos that are popular in Mexico City. https://t.co/ysK36u4PdC

name: sfchronicle
text:
Hundreds of masked mourners gathered in San Francisco’s Castro District to honor Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg, who died Friday of complications from metastatic pancreatic cancer.

Read more on the vigil: https://t.co/4qzO46jo5i https://t.co/4oHG3j8xia

name: sfchronicle
text:
A's close in on a playoff spot with a 6-0 win over the Giants. Oakland could clinch the AL West as soon as Saturday at the Coliseum.

https://t.co/5m1WZL91CO

name: sfchronicle
text:
Without Mike Yastrzemski, the punchless Giants fell to the A’s, 6-0, in the opener of a key series. With the loss, the Giants no longer hold one of two National League wild-card spots.

https://t.co/6OkoIv8Jp6

name: sfchronicle
text: “People are going to pretend they can live out their Sonoma or Ashland dreams, but it’s a lie,” said one person who two weeks ago fled the smoke in Oakland to Oregon, where he grew up. “The fires are coming for you.” https://t.co/axnCYeJWoK

name: sfchronicle
text: The Bay Area had been praised for keeping coronavirus case counts low, then experienced a summer spike. But how have the numbers here compared to some of the nation's biggest hot spots? https://t.co/mMDtY3YK43

name: sfchronicle
text: The consequences of replacing the liberal Ruth Bader Ginsburg with a conservative nominated by President Trump would be generational, writes @Joegarofoli. https://t.co/RE8SlGog56

name: sfchronicle
text:
Who do you want to see the Warriors draft? This quiz can help you decide. 
https://t.co/IVkOPP1nhh

name: sfchronicle
text: As the pandemic has worn on, many community houses have formed “super pods.” But the seal around one such house, the Manor of Being, was tight. As it squeezed them, burnout ensued. https://t.co/qQ9FTGrQSJ

name: sfchronicle
text: See air quality in your area in real time. This map shows ratings for the Bay Area and California, updated every 10 minutes: https://t.co/Q1tRUilC5X

name: sfchronicle
text:
Saturday morning update on the #NorthComplexFire in Plumas and Butte counties:

 - 289,951 acres
 - 58% contained
 - 15 fatalities
 - 1,147 structures destroyed
 - 74 structures damaged

Follow our fire tracker for the latest >> https://t.co/Y3ZSPKqmOB https://t.co/Eincg1d8nT

name: sfchronicle
text: Sunny weather and clear, smoke-free skies settled into the Bay Area on Saturday morning. https://t.co/aRJewCo5yP

name: sfchronicle
text: In SF, morning clouds were making way for the sun, with highs in the 70s expected and west winds up to 20 mph keeping the wildfire smoke from accumulating. Warmer parts of the east and south bay will reach the 80s. https://t.co/tn3wX7ZX7F

name: sfchronicle
text: Get ready for sunny weather and clear, smoke-free skies: Air quality reported as “good” around Bay Area as winds up to 20 mph keep wildfire smoke from accumulating. https://t.co/JI09mJI7PS

name: sfchronicle
text:
The #CreekFire in Fresno and Madera counties has grown to 248,256 acres and is 22% contained. 842 structures have been destroyed so far. 

Follow our fire tracker for the latest updates >> https://t.co/HQShLx5cPA https://t.co/1GC57VSYeo

name: sfchronicle

name: sfchronicle
text: S.F. startup Dispatch Goods has gradually been bringing reusable takeout containers into restaurants since last fall – with a goal to make that the norm. https://t.co/srCZ1t3Yil

name: sfchronicle
text: In a state where President Trump is wildly unpopular, GOP congressional candidates are being forced to try not to alienate the president and party faithful, while still appealing to host of never-Trumpers whose votes they need. https://t.co/V2VoXOu3pZ

name: sfchronicle
text: The @SFGiants’ outfield, already weakened by Mike Yastrzemski’s calf injury, will have to do without Alex Dickerson at least for Saturday. He departed for San Diego on paternity leave. https://t.co/xayPhInsYr

name: sfchronicle
text: Baylor’s season opener against Houston and Florida Atlantic’s game with Georgia Southern have both been postponed because of players testing positive for the coronavirus. https://t.co/rx9dMYVZJI

name: sfchronicle
text:
RT @TalKopan: There may be no single state’s Senate delegation more front and center in this SCOTUS confirmation battle as California’s. 

My story on the pressures on Sens. Feinstein and Harris:

https://t.co/crzMKa8Ld4

name: sfchronicle
text: .@DispatchGoods' vision is to make reusable takeout containers so normal that Bay Area residents will eventually have a fourth bin to hold them at their homes next to trash, recycling and compost. https://t.co/Nhov40ALwq

name: sfchronicle
text: RT @trapperbyrne: Unlike her CA Senate colleague Dianne Feinstein, Kamala Harris hasn't put much faith in working with the GOP. Their divergent tactics will bear watching as Dems decide how to respond if GOP confirms an RBG replacement. @TalKopan's story  https://t.co/urA0Kst4V1

name: sfchronicle
text:
The 49ers’ international house of pancakes was open for business last Sunday, with no social distancing.

@scottostler on new left tackle Trent Williams: https://t.co/i5eyuT9u1m

name: sfchronicle
text:
What's next for the Supreme Court?

California’s two senators will not only be major figures in the immediate confirmation fight — their approach to it will also signal Democrats’ long-term strategy against Republicans. https://t.co/flJfI8eB6c

name: sfchronicle
text: RT @demianbulwa: NEW from @TalKopan —> “With a political maelstrom growing over replacing Ginsburg, California’s senators will not only be major figures in the confirmation fight — their approach to it will also signal Democrats’ long-term strategy against Republicans.” https://t.co/t1SPjGhR2f

name: sfchronicle
text:
Republican candidates in California “are going to have to break away” from Trump,” an Orange County pollster said. “You can’t get elected with 33% of the vote.”

But getting that separation isn’t easy. https://t.co/vkgkIkoYKz

name: sfchronicle
text:
“I’m suffering. Right now I don’t have a job, and I don’t have enough money to pay for the rent. I miss customers, I miss working, I need money. I’m so scared.”

@FullerProject on the pandemic’s affect on California nail salons: https://t.co/UH5kpvwMPe

name: sfchronicle
text: From the Chronicle vault: These decisions made in 1871 changed the landscape of today’s Golden Gate Park. https://t.co/VE27WNgOMr

name: sfchronicle
text: Popular restaurants Square Pie Guys and Zuni Cafe, as well as the city of Alameda, have signed up to work with @DispatchGoods, which has a reusable packaging system for food. https://t.co/WqJ2UIHXIu

name: sfchronicle
text: JUST IN: The number of people hospitalized with COVID-19 in California fell once more to 2,663 — the lowest level since early April, and far below the peak of 7,170 on July 21. https://t.co/zXP7Z7IGfa

name: sfchronicle
text:
A complicated modeling system worked out each house member’s monthly risk budget: 250 points. What they did with their points didn’t matter, as long as points were logged in the spreadsheet.

But not all of the housemates trusted the system. https://t.co/DFYbwn3y81

name: sfchronicle
text: The big Bay Area complex fires are nearly completely contained but wildfires continue to burn throughout the state with the largest and fifth largest in state history in Northern California. https://t.co/ScibHl97uP

name: sfchronicle
text: Federal officials intercepted an envelope addressed to the White House that contained the poison ricin, a law enforcement official told The Associated Press on Saturday. https://t.co/leWhgtWSdx

name: sfchronicle
text:
House amenities reflect community values: a “play dungeon” with a ball pit, a palace of pillow forts. Photos of house members and friends line the walls.

How the Manor of Being, an 11-person intentional community in S.F., is navigating the coronavirus: https://t.co/1ynCjOhOCo

name: sfchronicle
text: A rap artist was shot and killed and two other people wounded when a shooter opened fire from a moving car on a busy Richmond street corner, police said. https://t.co/ClyITK5PVZ

text:

name: sfchronicle
text: 49ers' Dee Ford, who made availability a preseason goal after an injury plagued 2019, won't be available Sunday. https://t.co/pGl4simX3l

name: sfchronicle
text:
A father and his toddler son were out for a walk near Fort Funston on Saturday morning when they got stuck on a cliff. 

“This could have had a much worse ending,” SFFD Lt. Baxter said, “resulting in an injury or death.”

https://t.co/FI1TquzXQa

name: sfchronicle
text:
RT @JanelleBitker: Picture this: Your takeout comes in a reusable container. You eat and place the dirty container in a bin outside your house. A truck comes to pick up the containers, clean them and bring them back to restaurants.

In the Bay Area, it’s starting to happen https://t.co/zGRFFTJ5bG

name: sfchronicle
text: In San Francisco, where large employers like Salesforce, Google and Facebook have extended work-from-home policies through late summer 2021, some hotels are spinning guest rooms into work pods. https://t.co/VD6Lh4atmT

name: sfchronicle
text: A's manager Bob Melvin said the best-of-three first round in this year's expanded MLB postseason format is "more like baseball" than a one-game wild-card playoff. https://t.co/iwkNniOIH2
